SEARCH
Package org.abstractica.javacsg

Interface Geometry2D

All Superinterfaces:
Geometry
public interface Geometry2D extends Geometry
Represents an immutable two-dimensional geometric entity.

In addition to the general functionality provided by Geometry, this interface gives access to the geometry’s bounding region through minimum and maximum coordinates.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Vector2D
    getMax()
    Returns the maximum coordinate defining the upper bounds of this geometry’s extent.
    Vector2D
    getMin()
    Returns the minimum coordinate defining the lower bounds of this geometry’s extent.

    Methods inherited from interface org.abstractica.javacsg.Geometry

    debugMark, disable

  • Method Details

    • getMin

      Vector2D getMin()
      Returns the minimum coordinate defining the lower bounds of this geometry’s extent.

      Use this method to determine the geometry’s position or to compute bounding boxes.

      Returns:
      the minimum coordinate as a Vector2D

    • getMax

      Vector2D getMax()
      Returns the maximum coordinate defining the upper bounds of this geometry’s extent.

      Use this method together with getMin() to determine the geometry’s full spatial extent or to perform collision or containment checks.

      Returns:
      the maximum coordinate as a Vector2D
